Definition: Total population in Metro
Source: Censuses/Community survey/Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total population per square km by area type.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total households by type.
Source: Non-financial census / General Household Survey

Definition: Percentage increase or decrease in the population.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total female population in Metro.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total male population in Metro.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total number of males per 100 females.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total number of people aged 0-14 years and aged 65 years and older as a portion of the population aged 15-64 years per 100 population.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total population under 14 years of age.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total population 15-24 years of age.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total population 25-64 years of age.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Total population aged 66 years and older.
Source: Censuses / Community survey / Stats SA Mid-year estimates

Definition: Difference between in-migrantions and out-migrantions over a period of time.
Source: Censuses

Definition: Total number of international immigrants over a period of time per 1,000 population.
Source: Censuses

Definition: Number of registered indigent households.
Source: Non-financial census

Unit of Analysis: Number of People Living Below the National Poverty Line
Definition: Number of people living below the national poverty line.
Source: IHS Global Insight: Development. Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q). Poverty indicators. People below the lower poverty line (StatsSA defined).

Definition: A measure of inequality in income or wealth.
Source: IHS Global Insight: Development. Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q). Gini coefficient

Definition: The average number of years that a newborn could expect to live, if he/she were subject to the age-specific mortality rates of a given period.
Source: Statistics South Africa- Med-year population estimates 2014. Available [online] http://www.statssa.gov.za/publications/P0302/P03022014.pdf

Unit of Analysis: Total Value of Goods and Services Produced
Definition: Total value (Rands) of goods and services produced.
Source: Commercial, Global Insight

Definition: Value of all goods and services exported.
Source: HIS Global Insight: International Trade. Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q). Exports (R 1000)

Definition: Value of all goods and services imported.
Source: HIS Global Insight: International Trade. Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q). Imports (R 1000)

Definition: Total income from different sources for all household and by dwelling type.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Definition: The amount of money needed to sustain a certain level of living, including basic expenses such as housing, food, taxes, and healthcare.
Source: Income & Expenditure Survey, Statistics South Africa- Consumer Price Index: Index numbers and year-on-year rates. - CPI according to area

Definition: Total population employed and seeking employment within the 15-66 year age group.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Definition: Proportion of the total working-age population / EAP that is employed.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys. Formula to calculate (employment absorption rate ) EAR= Employed / working age population. Working age population = 15-65 years

Definition: Total (formal & informal), disaggregated by sector.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Definition: Number of unemployed workers as a proportion of the total labour force.
Source: Labour Force Survey

Definition: Women, youth, disabled proportion of unemployed.
Source: General Household Surveys

Definition: The HDI combines three dimensions: A long and healthy life: Life expectancy at birth; Education index: Mean years of schooling and Expected years of schooling; A decent standard of living: GNI per capita (PPP US$).
Source: IHS Global Insight: Development. Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q). HDI

Definition: Total population with access to the fixed-landline telephone / 100,000.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Definition: Total population with access to the mobile-cellular telephone / 100,000.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Definition: Total population with access to the Internet / 100,000.
Source: Censuses / Community Survey / General Household Surveys

Unit of Analysis: Amount of Water Available in the Catchment / Capita.
Definition: Amount of water available in the catchment per capita.
Source: DWA - Department of Water Affairs

Definition: Total amount of water used per capita.
Source: DWA - Department of Water Affairs

Definition: Non revenue water includes; unbilled authorised consumption, commercial water losses and physical leaks.
Source: WRC - Water Research Commission

Definition: The amount of water lost to use or no income derived from.
Source: Cities and WRC

Definition: Risk score - state of potable water - water quality (Green & Blue drop).
Source: Department of Water Affairs (DWA) available [online]: https://www.dwa.gov.za/ accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Risk score - state of potable water - water quality (Green & Blue drop).
Source: Department of Water Affairs (DWA) available [online]: https://www.dwa.gov.za/ accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Total energy supplied/purchased by service provider by fuel type.
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Total electricity sales (GWh/year).
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Energy consumption per unit of output by sector (eg manufacture, transport, service, residential, agriculture).
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015] **NB the unit of measure is (GJ /annum)

Unit of Analysis: Total Renewable Energy Generated by Municipality (KWh/year).
Definition: Total renewable energy generated by municipality (KWh/year).
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015]

Unit of Analysis: Amount of Energy Lost to Use
Definition: The amount of energy lost to use or no income derived from.
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Total volume of greenhouse gases (CO2, CH4, N2O, SF6, HFCs and PFCs) released into the atmosphere over a specified area and period of time.
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities- 2015. Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA). Available [online] http://www.sustainable.org.za/uploads/files/file80.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Waste diverted for recycling.
Source: Department of Environmental Affairs- South African Waste Information Centre: Available [online]: http://sawic.environment.gov.za/?menu=15

Unit of Analysis: Percentage of households using coal and wood fuel for heating and cooking.
Definition: Percentage of households using coal and wood fuel for heating and cooking.
Source: State of Energy in South African Cities

Unit of Analysis: Proportion of Metro set aside for open space / natural areas.
Definition: Proportion of Metro set aside for open space / natural areas.
Source: (1) Ethekwini- State of Biodiversity Reporting. Available [online] http://www.durban.gov.za/City_Services/development_planning_management/environmental_planning_climate_protection/Projects/Pages/State-of-Biodiversity-Reporting.aspx Accessed  [12-05-2015].

Definition: Not available.
Source: State of energy in South African Cties 2015

Definition: Not available.
Source: State of energy in South Africa 2015

Definition: Total number of learners by gender enrolled in primary school.
Source: Dept of Basic Education - SNAP Survey/Annual Schools Survey.  Available [online] http://www.education.gov.za/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=3BJmBjG%2bB3U%3d&tabid=462&mid=1326

Definition: Total number of learners by gender enrolled in secondary school.
Source: Dept of Basic Education - SNAP Survey/Annual Schools Survey. Available [online] http://www.education.gov.za/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=3BJmBjG%2bB3U%3d&tabid=462&mid=1326

Definition: Total number of learners to educators.
Source: Dept of Basic Education - SNAP Survey/Annual Schools Survey.  Available [online] http://www.education.gov.za/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=3BJmBjG%2bB3U%3d&tabid=462&mid=1326

Definition: Proportion of pupils starting grade 1 who reach last grade of primary school.
Source: Dept of Basic Education/General Household Survey

Definition: Proportion of pupils starting grade 7 who reach last grade of secondary school.
Source: Dept of Basic Education/General Household Survey

Unit of Analysis: Total Population Aged 15–24 Years who are Literate
Definition: Total population aged 15–24 years who are literate (can read and write) by age group, the result is then multiplied by 100.
Source: Dept of Basic Education/General Household Survey

Definition: Matric pass rate.
Source: Dept of Basic Education/General Household Survey

Definition: Number of hospital beds per 100 000 population.
Source: Dept of Health/ Health Systems Trust

Unit of Analysis: Number of Children Deaths under 5 years of age / 1 000 live births.
Definition: Number of children deaths under 5 years of age per 1 000 live births.
Source: Dept of Health/ Health Systems Trust

Definition: Number of people deprived of income, housing, health care, education, employment, housing, services, crime free and suitable living environment.
Source: The South African Index of Multiple Deprivation 2007 at Municipality Level. Available [online]: http://www.casasp.ox.ac.uk/imd.html#SAIMD07_mun accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Number of dwellings by type and location.
Source: Census/General Household Survey

Unit of Analysis: Number of Households by Tenure type
Definition: Number of households by tenure type and dwelling type with location.
Source: Census/General Household Survey

Definition: Percentage increase/decrease in number of informal shelter by location.
Source: Census/General Household Survey/ Metro's

Definition: Ratio average house price to the average employee remuneration.
Source: (1 )Understanding Housing Markets in South Africa- Prepared by Centre for Affordable Housing Finance in South Africa (CAHF) and South African Cities Network (SACN).  Available [online]: http://sacitiesnetwork.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/File-1-Overview.pdf Accessed [11-05-2015].  (2) Affordable Land and Housing Data Centre (al+hdc) and SACN: available [online]: http://www.alhdc.org.za/downloads/SACN%20NMB%20PPT%20profile%20Final%20draft.pdf accessed [11-05-2015]

Definition: Number of transport passengers by mode (ie private car, taxi, metrobus, rail, BRT,cyclists and pedestrians).
Source: National Household Travel Survey (NHTS). Available [online]: http://www.transport.gov.za/Portals/0/NHTS2/1.%20P0320%20-%20NHTS_February%20to%20March%202013%201-54.pdf accessed [12-05-2015] *NB information available on a provincial level only- pg 40

Unit of Analysis: Number of Cars Registered to Private Owners
Definition: Number of cars registered to private owners over time.
Source: RGT Smart / eNatis

Definition: Bed utilisation rate (BUR) measures the occupancy of available beds and therefore indicates how efficiently a hospital is using its available capacity. It is calculated as follows: the number of inpatient days is added to half the number of day patients, and divided by the usable bed days; this is expressed as a percentage.
Source: Health Systems Trust

Definition: Educational level is aggregated into no formal education, primary school (grade 1 to grade 7), secondary school (grade 8 to grade 12), diploma or certificate without grade 12 (from lower to grade 11), diploma or certificate with grade 12, degree and other post-degree.
Source: StatsSA census 2011

Unit of Analysis: Number of Vacancies at Senior Management Level
Definition: Number of vacancies at senior management level.
Source: Non-financial census

Definition: Number of staff posts by type.
Source: Non-financial census

Definition: Number of vacant posts.
Source: Non-financial census

Unit of Analysis: Number of Voters Registered to Vote in the Local Elections
Definition: Number of voters registered to vote in the local and national elections.
Source: Independent Electoral Commission (IEC)

Unit of Analysis: Number of Voters Registered to Vote in the National Elections
Definition: Number of registered voters voted in the local and national elections. Voter participation is the best existing means of measuring civic and political engagement for several reasons (high quality data, broad cross-country comparability) (OECD).
Source: Independent Electoral Commission (IEC)

Unit of Analysis: Number of Households Who Have Access to Water
Definition: Number of households who have access to water by type (ie none, RDP, piped, backlog).
Sub-Theme: Infrastructure, Service Delivery, Management and Maintenance
Source: IHS Global Insight- Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q): Household Infrastructure-Water infrastructure. Number of households by level of access to Water

Unit of Analysis: Number of Households Who Have Access to Sanitation
Definition: Percentage households who have access to sanitation by type (ie none, mainline, backlog).
Sub-Theme: Infrastructure, Service Delivery, Management and Maintenance
Source: IHS Global Insight- Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q): Household Infrastructure- Sanitation. Number of households by type of Toilet

Unit of Analysis: Number of Households Who Have Access to Electricity
Definition: Percentage households who have access to electricity.
Sub-Theme: Infrastructure, Service Delivery, Management and Maintenance
Source: IHS Global Insight- Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q): Household Infrastructure-Electricity connections. Number of households by electricity usage

Unit of Analysis: Number of Households Who Have Access to Refuse Removal
Definition: Percentage households who have access to refuse removal by type (ie none, weekly, less often).
Sub-Theme: Infrastructure, Service Delivery, Management and Maintenance
Source: IHS Global Insight- Regional eXplorer 759 (2.5q): Household Infrastructure- Refuse Removal. Number of households by access to refuse removal

Definition: Number of clinics operated by provincial government.
Sub-Theme: Infrastructure, Service Delivery, Management and Maintenance
Source: Dept of Health / Health Systems Trust

Definition: Status of audit findings.
Source: Auditor -General South Africa

Definition: Not available.
Source: Metros / Human Settlement

Definition: Budget income and budget expenditure.
Source: National Treasury Local Government Database

Definition: Money owed to metro by income source.
Source: National Treasury Local Government Database

Definition: Total cost of staff salaries.

Definition: Cash available.

Definition: Current assets minus inventory divided by the current liabilities.
Source: Financial census

Definition: Total liabilities of municipalities compared with their total revenue.

Definition: Current assets provide cover to meet current liabilities.
Source: Financial census

Definition: Proportion of debt municipalities have relative to their assets and provides and indication as to how much municipalities rely on debt to finance their assets.

Definition: Value of shortfall between budget and income.
Source: National Treasury Local Government Database

Definition: Value of wasteful expenditure.
Source: National Treasury Local Government Database

Definition: Operating expenditures refer to expenditures related to running a city and providing services. They include bulk purchases, employee-related costs, repairs and maintenance and 'other' expenditure.
Source: State of City Finance 2015

Definition: The affordability of municipal bills depends in part upon the rates and charges and in part upon household incomes. Type A is a household that lives in a property with an assessed value of R100,000, consumes 400kWh of electricity and 20kl of water per month, and has a 240 litre bin removed weekly.
Source: Type A - poor household in SoCF 2015
